summary: This research investigates the impact of R&D investment on firm performance, highlighting the influence of internal factors such as intellectual capital and organizational learning. It identifies gaps in existing literature regarding the dynamics of this relationship. By establishing a theoretical model, the study explores how R&D investment interacts with intellectual capital and organizational learning to affect firm performance. The findings indicate that intellectual capital serves as a complete mediator in the relationship between R&D investment and firm performance, while organizational learning acts as a moderator between R&D investment and human capital. Ultimately, the research underscores the significant roles of both intellectual capital and organizational learning in enhancing the effectiveness of R&D investments.
